intro: Kickxia elatine subsp. crinita, commonly known as the hairy yellow bell, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in wet meadows and stream sides. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are hairy, giving it its common name. It is a perennial species that blooms from late spring to early summer.
